column1: #Text=Polycrystalline TaS2 was synthesized by a solid-state reaction from stoichiometric Ta and S powders.
#Text=These were sealed into an evacuated quartz tube and sintered at 950 °C for 4 days.
#Text=CVT was used for the synthesis of single crystals of TaS2.
#Text=The obtained polycrystalline TaS2 and iodine of 5 mg/cm3 as a transporting agent were added in a closed quartz tube and sintered using a temperature gradient from 800 to 900 °C for 7 days.

#Text=To intercalate alkali metal ions (e.g., K+ , Na+ , and Li+ ) into TaS2, phosphate glasses containing each alkali metal ion31 were prepared using a conventional melt-quenching technique as the ion-source materials, which must exhibit ion conducting properties at the treatment temperature of PDII.
#Text=The raw materials A2CO3, La2O3, and H3PO4 (A = K, Na, and Li) were weighed and mixed.
#Text=They were then melted in a platinum crucible for 30 min at 1200 °C in air.

#Text=The molten materials were poured into a cylindrical carbon mold with an inner diameter of 10 mm, annealed at 380 °C for 1 h, and gradually cooled to room temperature in a furnace at a cooling rate of 30 °C/h.
#Text=Disk-shaped glass plates with a diameter of 10 mm and a thickness of 1 mm were sliced from the cylindrical glass block, and both surfaces were polished.
